description: Once a thriving city-state on an eastern peninsula of the Endless Sea, Grift is now crumbling under the weight of its own bureaucracy. Protected from the world by the bottomless Múr and three cyclopean bridges, its ruling merchant class feuds internally while King Sigfúm the Kind prepares its people for a prophesied mass death at Cliff Terion [1-3]. Established by travelers seeking a land free of religion, built atop an ancient, scrubbed cathedral structure, the city now struggles with lurking horrors and its own internal decay.

districts.name: Central Palace
districts.description: The heart of Grift's crumbling bureaucracy, housing the Palace and its many internal chambers. Once the seat of power, it is now often abandoned by the King, leaving clerks and assistants to grapple with endless paperwork.
notable_buildings: The Palace of Grift (Grand Entryway, Main Study, King's Guard Garrison, King's Keep, Bell, King's Study)
encounters: Feuding nobles and clerks quarreling over power and absurd laws
Overworked, exhausted clerks unable to perform their duties
Haggard Watchmen present but easily distracted or bribed
The King's abandoned chambers or the Bell Chamber
random_tables: 1-2: A clerk attempts to hide from their duties, then flees if addressed
3-4: A personal assistant vibrates with decades of waiting for the Count to call them in
5-6: Twelve dogs run rampant, overwhelming a dog-clerk who begs for help
atmosphere_modifiers: The thick grease from candle-smoke hangs heavy in the air
The rumble of distant thunder (or a clerk's voice)
The sound of dog barking and vocalizing, without meaning

districts.name: Market Quarter
districts.description: A bustling but often chaotic area, where merchants attempt to ply their wares amidst the city's decay and the populace's despair. Goods from distant lands can be found, but often at inflated prices.
encounters: Desperate citizens begging for food or trade
Merchants haggling fiercely, often about illicit goods
Rumors of the city's impending doom or strange happenings
Courtyard dregs looking for work or shelter
random_tables: 1-2: A desperate citizen offers a 'King's Pie' (rotting meat in red liquid) for sale
3-4: A group of youths gamble with 'Slanted Dice'
5-6: A vendor sells goods 'liberated' from the Palace
atmosphere_modifiers: The smell of decay mixed with strange spices
The clamor of voices, both desperate and cunning
Wisps of smoke from cookfires and burning rubbish

districts.name: Artisan Quarter
districts.description: Home to the city's craftspeople, where the air often carries the scent of various materials being worked. Despite the city's decline, some artisans still strive for excellence.
notable_buildings: Tanneries (implied by similar areas in other cities)
encounters: Artisans seeking rare materials or offering unique crafted goods
Arguments over resources or quality of work
Potential for criminal elements seeking to control trades
random_tables: 1-2: A smith offers to repair damaged armor or weapons for a high price
3-4: The pungent smell of tanning hides fills the air, causing Toughness tests for those unused to it
5-6: A craftsman attempts to pawn off a shoddy but ornate item
atmosphere_modifiers: The clang of hammers and the buzz of saws
The strong scent of leather and curing hides
Occasional flashes of light from active forges

districts.name: Scribes' Quarter
districts.description: A quieter district, dominated by the Scribes' Tower, where knowledge is meticulously (or haphazardly) recorded amidst the encroaching chaos. Its inhabitants are often focused on documenting the city's decline and prophecies.
encounters: Scribes frantically recording events or translating ancient texts
Academics or archivists seeking rare documents or information
Feral gangs of scribes fighting for ink
random_tables: 1-2: A scribe mistakes the PCs for agents of Galgenbeck and attempts to hide or flee
3-4: A pile of forgotten records bursts into spontaneous combustion
5-6: A frantic scribe attempts to hire the PCs to retrieve a missing section of an important ledger
atmosphere_modifiers: The faint scent of old paper and ink
The scratching of quills and the rustle of parchment
An oppressive silence, broken only by distant city sounds

districts.name: Lower City
districts.description: The lowest parts of Grift, where the city's less savory elements and unsanitary facilities are concentrated. Infested with vermin and shadowed by the grim realities of survival.
encounters: Swarms of rats and other vermin
Impoverished citizens, possibly resorting to desperate measures
Hidden hideouts for criminals or outcasts
Apparitions or strange sounds linked to Lir's spawn
random_tables: 1-2: A large band of rats swarms out of the gutters, attacking anything in their path
3-4: A 'corpse collector' roams the polluted gutters, looking for bodies
5-6: Strange, translucent bubbles float from the shit pit, screaming as they deflate
atmosphere_modifiers: The overpowering stench of excrement and decay
The constant skittering of unseen creatures
A heavy, damp gloom, even during the day

districts.name: Worker's Enclave
districts.description: Residential and functional areas for the common laborers of Grift, often overlooked and struggling. Here, the daily grind of survival is most evident.
notable_buildings: Minor trade posts for daily necessities
encounters: Workers toiling away or seeking meager employment
Signs of poverty and desperation among the populace
Potential for unrest or rebellion due to harsh conditions
random_tables: 1-2: A group of exhausted workers collapses in the street from fatigue
3-4: A family begs for aid, having sold all their possessions for food
5-6: A lone worker quietly gathers discarded bones, possibly for a meal
atmosphere_modifiers: The murmuring of tired voices and the clatter of tools
A persistent smell of sweat and stale food
The somber mood of constant struggle

districts.name: Guard Quarter
districts.description: The Barracks and associated military structures, where the King's Guard is notionally stationed. Despite their presence, order is often maintained only by appearances, and guards are easily distracted or avoid duty.
encounters: Haggard and cold Watchmen
Guards who are disinterested or easily bribed
Disgraced former captains of the fortress guards, languishing in apathy
random_tables: 1-2: d4 Watchmen blearily doing their rounds, easily convinced to look the other way
3-4: A 'distracted scholar' from the Urniversity attempts to solicit mercenaries for a Slatehead Termite Grub
5-6: A patrol of Basilisk knights searches for heretics
atmosphere_modifiers: The faint jingle of ill-maintained armor
The smell of stale wine and unwashed bodies
A pervasive sense of boredom and resignation

districts.name: Múr's Edge
districts.description: The treacherous perimeter along the bottomless Múr, marked by the immense bridges. Few dare to linger here, as the bridges scream nightly and strange creatures crawl from the cracked earth.
encounters: Creatures crawling from the dried, cracked earth
The disorienting sounds of the screaming bridges
Potential encounters with those trying to escape or enter Grift
random_tables: 1-2: The closest bridge emits an unusually loud, painful shriek
3-4: Small, dry creatures with leathery wings emerge from cracks in the earth
5-6: A lone sailor, marked as the 'lowest of the low', attempts to cross the Múr
atmosphere_modifiers: A cold, biting wind carrying dust from beyond the Múr
The constant, low roar and scream of the bridges
The eerie silence of this exposed, desolate area

districts.name: Outskirts_North
districts.description: The northern periphery of the city, less developed and closer to the wild, where the influence of the city's internal decay meets the encroaching external threats.
encounters: Vagrants and refugees seeking entry or shelter
Smugglers or shady individuals operating outside city limits
King Fathmu's agents hunting Nagl (if connected)
random_tables: 1-2: A pack of feral dogs roots through garbage piles outside the gate
3-4: A 'beggar who knows a lot' offers cryptic warnings about the city
5-6: A 'dying horse' calls out a PC's name, speaking of a noble master in Grift
atmosphere_modifiers: The faint, distant sounds of the city, muffled by distance
The smell of dry dust and wild vegetation
An unsettling quiet, broken by the rustle of wind

districts.description: The eastern periphery of the city, less developed and closer to the wild, where the influence of the city's internal decay meets the encroaching external threats.
encounters: Vagrants and refugees seeking entry or shelter
Smugglers or shady individuals operating outside city limits
King Fathmu's agents hunting Nagl (if connected)
random_tables: 1-2: A patrol of haggard and cold Watchmen stands guard at the East Gate
3-4: A 'corrupted official' attempts to demand an illegal 'entry tax'
5-6: A band of 'courtyard dregs' attempts to bartere for passage through the gates
atmosphere_modifiers: The faint, distant sounds of the city, muffled by distance
The smell of dry dust and wild vegetation
An unsettling quiet, broken by the rustle of wind

districts.description: The western periphery of the city, less developed and closer to the wild, where the influence of the city's internal decay meets the encroaching external threats.
encounters: Vagrants and refugees seeking entry or shelter
Smugglers or shady individuals operating outside city limits
King Fathmu's agents hunting Nagl (if connected)
random_tables: 1-2: A small, isolated hovel hides an outlaw seeking refuge from the city's laws
3-4: A 'retired mercenary' offers their services for hire, eager for coin
5-6: A group of 'gutterborn scum' attempts to pickpocket passersby
atmosphere_modifiers: The faint, distant sounds of the city, muffled by distance
The smell of dry dust and wild vegetation
An unsettling quiet, broken by the rustle of wind

districts.description: The southern periphery of the city, less developed and closer to the wild, where the influence of the city's internal decay meets the encroaching external threats.
encounters: Vagrants and refugees seeking entry or shelter
Smugglers or shady individuals operating outside city limits
King Fathmu's agents hunting Nagl (if connected)
random_tables: 1-2: An 'immortal beggar Ulf' assaults passersby
3-4: A group of 'sacrifice volunteers' awaits guidance or prepares for their fate
5-6: A 'tortured traitor' speaks of secret passages beneath the city
atmosphere_modifiers: The faint, distant sounds of the city, muffled by distance
The smell of dry dust and wild vegetation
An unsettling quiet, broken by the rustle of wind

districts.name: Trade Ward
districts.description: Situated near the bridges and jetties, this area serves as Grift's main artery for external commerce. Vessels are moored, laden with goods, but also often serve as cover for illicit activities.
encounters: Bloodhunters offering hunting tips but never revealing prey locations
Desperate Hunters selling locations of creature nurseries
Sailors bearing tales from the Endless Sea
random_tables: 1-2: A vessel laden with skins and meat, stinking of death, is moored at the jetty
3-4: Riggers and butchers haul immense beast carcasses using a Butcher-Crane
5-6: A 'scoundrel covered in ulcers' attempts to sell suspicious 'aged' meat
atmosphere_modifiers: The pervasive smell of meat, hides, and salt
The creaking of wood and the lapping of waves against moored vessels
The harsh cries of gulls seeking scraps

districts.name: Cliff Terion
districts.description: A thousand-meter vertical rock face over the raging sea, destined as the site for King Sigfúm's prophesied mass suicide. A place of grim significance, where a 'gift' may have been placed to bring the city to its knees.
encounters: King Sigfúm's loyalists making grim preparations for the mass suicide
Inquisition agents of the Two-Headed Basilisks attempting to thwart the heretical scheme
Unseen forces related to the 'gift' beneath the cliff
random_tables: 1-2: A group of Sigfúm's people gathers, performing a quiet ritual of farewell
3-4: A 'badly burned priest' observes the cliff from a distance, muttering prophecies
5-6: The faint sound of digging emanates from below the cliff face
atmosphere_modifiers: A chilling wind carrying the spray of the sea
The distant, mournful cries of gulls
An overwhelming sense of impending finality and despair

random_tables: 1-2: King Sigfúm's parchments are posted throughout the city, marking a new day of preparation for death
3-4: The nightly screaming of the bridges intensifies, causing widespread fear and paranoia among the citizens
5-6: A large gathering of Lir's spawn is sighted in an unexpected part of the city, their movements disturbing the peace
7-8: A petty noble seeks assistance in retrieving lost property or capturing a 'problematic' individual (e.g., a dying horse's master)
atmosphere_modifiers: The constant screams and roars of the three bridges at night
The pervasive stench of decay and cooking meat permeates the air
Parchments detailing death preparations flutter in the streets
The sound of feuding merchants and demanding commoners echoes through the alleys
The hidden, disorienting pulse of Lir's spawn can be faintly felt beneath the city
